executive_summary: Demand for the industry is dependent on the health of the housing and property markets, as well as on levels of per capita disposable income, since landscaping services are often discretionary. Landscapers also rely on institutional and commercial clients because they generate higher revenue per service.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Landscaping Services is Influenced by Weather Patterns
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Landscaping Services industry provides services that range from basic lawn mowing and maintenance to more-complex landscape design and

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential Clients Are A Lynchpin To Demand For Landscaping Services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Landscaping services are tied to property markets because residential properties represent one of the largest market segments. Consumers have been in a better position to pay for landscaping services, as disposable incomes, which determine their ability to spend on nonessential services like landscaping, have expanded.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The COVID-19 Pandemic Has Been Key To Housing Market Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite the temporary economic downturn created by the COVID-19 pandemic, it counterintuitively produced new demand for the landscaping. Demand for landscaping services is tied to trends in property markets because residential assets represent one of the industry's largest segments.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RESIDENTIAL CLIENTS WILL REMAIN KEY TO GROWTH, EVEN WITH HIGHER INTEREST RATES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of residential clients will continue to grow as the overall housing market increases and consumer financial health remains strong. However, the growth rates of the COVID-19 pandemic era will be a thing of the past as the Federal Reserve keeps interest rates elevated to battle inflation.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AMONG RESIDENTIAL CUSTOMERS, LANDSCAPERS WILL TARGET SENIOR CITIZENS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The aging American population will require landscaping services to maintain their homes, and landscaping firms are expected to target these clients.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growth in Commercial Demand is Expected
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Lucrative commercial projects like resort and hotel grounds installation and maintenance will rise as consumers increase spending on travel. This trend has already been on display as pandemic-era restrictions have been lifted around the world, and travel will only pick up as consumers seek to make up for years of reduced travel.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Labor Shortages Will Remain a Staple
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many workers have left labor market altogether during the COVID-19 pandemic, making labor shortages a norm across the economy. The industry has not been immune to this trend.

industry_definition: This industry primarily provides landscape care and maintenance services, including planting trees, shrubs, flowers, lawns or gardens. Industry companies may also design landscape plans or construct walkways, retaining walls, decks, fences, ponds and similar structures. The design of large-scale landscaped areas, such as the campuses of hospitals or schools, is included in the Landscape Design industry (IBISWorld report 54132).

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: Companies always under pressure to lower prices. Negotiating on price is a hallmark of the industry, pressuring landscapers to keep
Households use free time to cut out landscapers. Companies compete with residential customers who prefer to complete their own yard work.
A residential construction boom during the COVID-19 pandemic
Commercial construction activity continues to drop
Landscapers operate on a regional or local basis
Strict enforcement of labor regulations limits workforce
Housing boom has generated demand for lawncare

market_segmentation.segment_description: The commercial market includes resorts and hotels, retail centers, corporate campuses and other office and business space. Landscaping for commercial clients includes design and construction of new green spaces, lawn mowing, tree maintenance, irrigation, pest control and

The residential market includes both single-family and multifamily structures like apartment buildings. As housing starts increase and home improvement spending rises, the residential client base grows, increasing demand for landscaping. However, the majority of services are from existing homeowners, making consumer financial health a primary driver of demand for landscaping. Residential housing has boomed over the current five-year period, producing more demand for landscaping services.

The institutional and public-sector segment includes landscaping services at municipal parks, schools, hospitals, community centers and other public spaces. Federal support for government budgets through have allowed institutional clients to maintain spending on landscaping services.

products_and_services.product_description: Commercial landscaping services include work for commercial facilities, municipal buildings and campuses. Landscapers typically use commercial-grade lawn mowers, weed trimmers and clippers for branch removal, in addition to pesticides and herbicides for insect and weed control. Commercial services at large office buildings typically command a premium and are important to the profitability of large companies.

Residential landscaping services include small-scale design provided by companies that maintain and install lawn and garden features. However, this segment also includes construction of embankments, terraces and retaining walls used in landscape structures, as well as walkways, decks, fences, and ponds.
Services for residential customers are heavily dependent on higher-income households that are able to afford extensive landscaping projects.
Arborists manage trees within a small area, and services include tree felling and surgery, as well as trimming operations that require specialized equipment.

tier_1_suppliers: Flower & Nursery Stock Wholesaling in the US
Home Improvement Stores in the US
Farm, Lawn & Garden Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
SUV & Light Truck Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The construction of resorts, schools, retail centers, corporate campuses and other spaces that incorporate green areas drives demand for landscaping services. As nonresidential construction activity increases, demand for landscaping services increases as well.

The value of residential construction, which includes multifamily structures such as apartment buildings, incorporates landscaped outdoor areas; this drives demand for maintenance services provided by this industry. As the value of residential construction rises, including spending on privately owned home improvements, the need for lawn, tree and garden care increases. Contractions of the value of residential construction pose a potential threat to the industry.

Changes in household disposable income have a direct effect on demand for landscaping services. Because gardening and landscaping services are discretionary expenditures, they can be readily canceled or deferred when households want to decrease spending. As a result, demand for industry services typically correlates with levels of per capita disposable income.

Households with above-average disposable incomes are more likely to spend on landscaping services to improve the attractiveness of their homes. While their higher incomes enable them to spend more on discretionary services, including those provided by this industry, households earning more than $100,000 annually still tend to reduce nonessential spending and become more price-conscious during economic downturns. Still, they remain a more consistent market for residential landscapers than households with lower incomes. Growth in the number of households earning more than $100,000 represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

Government spending on the maintenance of parks, schools, hospitals, community centers and other public areas drives demand for landscape services provided by this industry. Other niche services in this industry, such as tree pruning and snowplowing, benefit from government spending as well. As governments aim to balance their budgets, services provided by this industry could suffer.

business_locations.location_description: The largest share of landscapers are located in the Southeast region, which has the highest share of the nation's population. The Southeast region has several large single-family housing markets like Florida, which typically have large lawns that require landscaping services. The region is also known for its year-round warm weather, which creates constant irrigation and lawn care, especially during the hot summer months.

The Mid-Atlantic region's above-average median household income levels allow individuals to pay for professional upkeep services for their lawns. While the region's climate is fairly temperate, winter months typically bring snowstorms, making snow and ice management a significant industry service for the area.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Stringency of safety measures is on the rise
regulations_points.regulation_description: Occupational safety and health provisions require training for using machinery and tools and require the use of personal protective equipment.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Labor regulations tighten to limit work by undocumented workers
regulations_points.regulation_description: The federal government's E-Verify program compares the employment eligibility information that an employee supplies with several US government records.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry assistance level is low and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies are always under pressure to lower prices. Negotiating on price is a hallmark of the industry, pressuring landscapers to keep prices competitive.
Households use free time to cut out landscapers. Companies compete with residential customers who prefer to complete their own yard work.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The sheer volume of small-scale, low-value work conducted by small companies in the single-family housing market prevents larger companies from capturing a substantial portion of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising oil prices a detriment to travel-dependent companies
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Since landscape contractors travel to the worksite, gas prices have significant influence over operating costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor key to lawn care, especially for large companies with reputations to maintain
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The majority of workers are hired to perform manual tasks, such as lawn mowing, tree and shrub pruning and turf installation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Landscaping is not capital intensive and does not rely heavily on expensive equipment.
Most tools and equipment used have low costs and work is highly dependent on labor.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic conditions influence success for operators
volatility_points.volatility_description: Good economic conditions increase demand for landscaping services as consumers chose to outsource services rather than perform them themselves.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Spending on residential and nonresidential construction is lynchpin
volatility_points.volatility_description: The number of homes and commercial properties with green spaces creates demand for landscaping.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Commercial services see the deployment of new tools
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Improvements in equipment have increased efficiency in the maintenance of commercial properties.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Some larger companies use enhanced technology to gain a competitive edge
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Larger companies that use administrative and design software have benefited from improving computer technology over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How dependent are you on the public sector?
FAQs.answer: The public sector accounts for a relatively small portion of revenue, but its impact isn't insignificant. These contracts are likely held by well-known landscapers.

FAQs.question: Has competition from low-wage countries hurt your business?
FAQs.answer: The H-2B worker program helps meet the industry's seasonal needs by allowing employers to hire seasonal workers. Foreign workers can be hired in the United States if there are not enough domestic workers to complete tasks and if the employment of foreign workers doesn't negatively affect the wages of domestic workers who perform the same task.

FAQs.question: Does your business need to be located near key consumer or client markets?
FAQs.answer: Moving away from clients raises the transportation costs for landscapers.

FAQs.question: Has your company looked into relocating its operations to lower-wage countries?
FAQs.answer: Services are performed at specific locations, so there can be no outsourcing outside of the country.

FAQs.question: Does your business use web-based systems for customer bookings or orders?
FAQs.answer: There's little need for web-based systems to perform landscaping services, but some landscapers use the technology for orders.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce costs through automation?
FAQs.answer: Landscaping services are entirely reliant on labor. Better equipment can aid laborers, but automation itself is impractical.

FAQs.question: Is obtaining state certification or licensing necessary for your business?
FAQs.answer: There's no formal training or licenses required for basic lawn mowing services.

FAQs.question: Have energy-efficiency regulations positively impacted your business?
FAQs.answer: New technologies used to comply with energy-efficient regulations increase profit in the long term by reducing fuel costs. In the short run, the higher capital costs adversely affect profit.

FAQs.question: How dependent is your company on borrowed finances?
FAQs.answer: Few landscapers require loans for capital investments. Some landscapers use debt financing to expand their operations or to expand geographically.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Many landscapers use seasonal or part-time workers to deal with the seasonality of landscaping services.

FAQs.question: How do you make sure your prices are attractive to customers? Who is your biggest competition based on pricing?
FAQs.answer: Much of the commercial and municipal work generated in this industry is determined through the tendering process, and landscaping companies must be able to successfully tender for contracts while ensuring sufficient profit and cash flow.

FAQs.question: Are there channels for promotion and career development within your company? How do you reward staff who perform well?
FAQs.answer: Companies need to have access to a large pool of available workers who can be trained and used on a seasonal basis.

FAQs.question: How often are you affected by climatic conditions? What Appropriate Climatic Conditions?
FAQs.answer: It's important to be aware of the effect that climate shifts, events and seasons can have on business demand, including excessive snow, rain, heat and drought.

FAQs.question: Which demographic provides your company with the highest demand? What income bracket is most likely to require your company's services?
FAQs.answer: While their higher incomes enable them to spend more on discretionary services, including those provided by this industry, households earning more than $100,000 annually tend to reduce nonessential spending and become more price-conscious during economic downturns.

FAQs.question: Do you target wealthy consumers and business clients?
FAQs.answer: Government spending on the maintenance of parks, schools, hospitals, community centers and other public areas drives demand for landscape services provided by this industry.

FAQs.question: Does demand for your services correlate with new construction projects? Do you have major contracts with construction companies?
FAQs.answer: As the value of residential construction rises, including spending on privately owned home improvements, the need for lawn, tree and garden care increases.
